text: Zophar’s First Response to Job
Then\f + \fr 11:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Zophar the Naamathite answered and said,
“Should an abundance of words go unanswered,
or ⸤a man full of talk⸥\f + \fr 11:2 \ft Literally “a man of lips” \f* be vindicated?\f + \fr 11:2 \ft Hebrew “should he be vindicated” \f*
Should your loose talk put people to silence?
⸤And when you mock, shall no one put you to shame⸥?\f + \fr 11:3 \ft Literally “And you will mock there is not putting to shame” \f*
For you say, ‘My teaching \add is\add* pure,
and I am clean in your sight.’
But,\f + \fr 11:5 \ft Hebrew “And but” \f* ⸤O that⸥\f + \fr 11:5 \ft Literally “who shall give” \f* God might speak,
and \add that\add* he would open his lips to you,
and \add that\add* he would tell you \add the\add* secrets of wisdom,
for ⸤insight has many sides⸥.\f + \fr 11:6 \ft Literally “double to sound wisdom” \f*
And know that God ⸤on your behalf⸥\f + \fr 11:6 \ft Literally “for you” \f* has forgotten ⸤some of⸥\f + \fr 11:6 \ft Literally “from” \f* your guilt.
“Can you find \add out\add* the essence of God,
or can you find \add out\add* ⸤the ultimate limits⸥\f + \fr 11:7 \ft Literally “up to \fq the \ft limit” \f* of Shaddai?
⸤It is higher than the heaven⸥;\f + \fr 11:8 \ft Literally “heights of heaven” \f* what can you do?
\add It is\add* deeper than Sheol; what can you know?
Its measure \add is\add* longer than \add the\add* earth
and broader than \add the\add* sea.
“If he passes through and imprisons someone\f + \fr 11:10 \ft Hebrew “and he imprisons” \f*
⸤and summons the assembly⸥,\f + \fr 11:10 \ft Literally “and he summons” \f* then\f + \fr 11:10 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* who can hinder him?
For he knows ⸤those who are worthless⸥;\f + \fr 11:11 \ft Literally “men of worthlessness” \f*
⸤when he sees⸥\f + \fr 11:11 \ft Literally “And he will see” \f* iniquity, ⸤he will not consider it⸥.\f + \fr 11:11 \ft Literally “and he will not consider” \f*
But\f + \fr 11:12 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* ⸤an empty-headed person⸥\f + \fr 11:12 \ft Literally “a man hollowed out” \f* will get understanding
when\f + \fr 11:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* a wild donkey’s colt is born \add as\add* a human being.
“If you yourself\f + \fr 11:13 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* direct your heart
and stretch out your hands to him—
if iniquity\f + \fr 11:14 \ft See v. \xt 11 \ft , where the same word is used \f* \add is\add* in your hand, put it far away,
and you must not let wickedness reside in your tents—
surely then you will lift up your face without\f + \fr 11:15 \ft Hebrew “from” \f* blemish,
and you will be firmly established and will not fear.\f + \fr 11:15 \ft Hebrew “and not will you fear” \f*
For you yourself\f + \fr 11:16 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* will forget your misery;
you will remember \add it\add* as water \add that\add* has flowed past.
“⸤And your life will be brighter than noon⸥;\f + \fr 11:17 \ft Literally “And from noon lifespan will arise” \f*
\add its\add* darkness will be like the morning.
And you will have confidence because there is hope;
and you will be well protected—⸤you will sleep in safety⸥.\f + \fr 11:18 \ft Literally “you will lie down securely” \f*
And you will lie down, and ⸤no one will make you afraid⸥;\f + \fr 11:19 \ft Literally “there is not making afraid” \f*
⸤and many will entreat your favor⸥.\f + \fr 11:19 \ft Literally “and they will appease/implore your faces many” \f*
But\f + \fr 11:20 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* \add the\add* eyes of \add the\add* wicked will fail;
and refuge will be lost to them,
and their hope \add is\add* ⸤to breathe their last breath⸥.”\f + \fr 11:20 \ft Literally “the expiring of soul” \f*
